intro: Navarretia watsonii, commonly known as Watson's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across arid and semi-arid regions. Navarretia watsonii is often found in California and parts of Nevada, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils.
